gastroenterology: Blood in stool or black-colored stool
cardiology: Chest pain and shortness of breath
Swelling in legs or ankles (possible heart failure)
pulmonary: Shortness of breath during daily activities
Coughing up blood or mucus with unusual color
endocrinology/metabolism: Fatigue and sensitivity to cold or heat
nephrology: Swelling in feet, ankles, or around the eyes
Changes in urination frequency or color
Persistent lower back or flank pain
hematology oncology: Unexplained weight loss and night sweats
allergy: Skin rashes or hives after certain exposures
hepato-biliary & pancreas surgery: Unexplained weight loss with digestive discomfort
colorectal surgery: Rectal bleeding or blood in stool
breast surgery: Lump or thickening in breast tissue
Changes in breast shape or skin texture
Nipple discharge that is bloody or clear
